thread.title: Stars of the week
thread.title_full: Stars of the week | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Stars of the week
text:
DIVISION 1
• Jared Martino completed 15-of-16 passes for 265 yards and four touchdowns as Malden defeated Somerville, 42-19.
•    Lowell earned its first win of the year as Matt Smith threw for 247 yards and four touchdowns in a 41-19 victory against Chelmsford.
• Matt Long ran for 198 yards and two touchdowns on 27 carries as Weymouth coasted to a 24-3 win against Brookline.
DIVISION 2
•     Joe Samuelman ran for 147 yards and four touchdowns as North Andover rolled past Dracut, 37-0.
•   Austin Burton completed 15-of-20 passes for 301 yards and five TDs as unbeaten Newton South pounded Cambridge, 40-6.
DIVISION 3
•   Bobby Maimaron completed 16-of-22 passes for 189 yards and four touchdowns, while rushing for 132 yards, in leading Duxbury to a 31-21 win against Whitman-Hanson.
• Mike Pedrini rushed for 166 yards and four touchdowns as Melrose remained undefeated with a 28-7 win against Watertown.
•   Chenet Guerrier ran for 187 yards and four scores as Burlington handed Stoneham its first loss, 35-25.
• Aidan Brown rushed for 215 yards and tallied three touchdowns as North Quincy picked up its first win, 41-6, against Pembroke.
• Zach Lanzetta completed 16-of-19 passes for 302 yards and four touchdowns in the first half as Milford rolled past Oliver Ames, 42-8.
• Kejuan Farquharson rushed for 239 yards and three touchdowns and threw for a score as Concord-Carlisle crushed Wayland, 35-14.
•  Troy Carey ran for 153 yards and a touchdown as Tewksbury defeated Andover, 29-12.
DIVISION 4
• Liam Wrean ran for 213 yards and scored four touchdowns to lead Weston to a 35-18 victory against Medford. He also threw for 73 yards and a score.
• Brad Rogers rushed for 116 yards and four scores as Hanover rolled to a 49-7 win against Scituate.
• Andrew Jamiel rumbled for 206 yards and three touchdowns, while adding a punt return for a fourth score, as Dennis-Yarmouth topped Sandwich, 28-6.
• Jon Gonzalez ran for 97 yards and scored three touchdowns to give Winthrop its first win, 37-15, against Salem.
DIVISION 5
•   Aidan Silva piled up 148 yards and four touchdowns as Case defeated Springfield Cathedral, 27-0, to improve to 3-1 on the season.
•    Cam Gass rushed for two scores and also returned a punt for a third TD as Cardinal Spellman defeated Austin Prep, 38-0.
• Jon Hargreaves ran for 150 yards and two scores and also caught a TD pass in Dover-Sherborn’s 27-8 victory against Bellingham.
DIVISION 6
• Lynn Tech’s Steffan Gravely rushed for 161 yards and three touchdowns, and returned an interception 55 yards for a fourth score, in a 27-0 shutout of Mystic Valley.
•    Ivan Mertilus ran for 144 yards and three touchdowns as St. Clement knocked Cathedral from the ranks of the unbeaten with a 24-22 win.
• Josh Pierre-Charles rushed for 192 yards and three scores as Millis-Hopedale won its second straight, 34-21, against Norton.
• Chris Norton ran for 222 yards and two touchdowns while adding eight tackles as Cohasset defeated Mashpee, 21-6.
ISL/PREP
•   Dave LaMountain completed 11-of-17 passes for 127 yards and two touchdowns and ran for a third as St. George’s defeated St. Mark’s, 34-6. He also keyed a strong defensive effort with 10 tackles and placed two punts inside the 10-yard line.
•    Jeff Costello threw for 272 yards and three touchdowns, while rushing for 141 yards and three scores, as BB&N outscored Belmont Hill, 62-34. James O’Regan had nine catches for 231 yards and three scores.
• Groton’s opener was a smashing success as John Beatty ran for 189 yards and three scores in a 45-10 thrashing of Rivers.
